verses.kjv: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that executeth judgment, that seeketh the truth; and I will pardon it.
verses.web: “Run back and forth through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in its wide places, if you can find a man, if there is anyone who does justly, who seeks truth, then I will pardon her.
verses.ct: "Search every street in Jerusalem. Look carefully and check every public square. If you can find even one person who acts justly and seeks the truth, I will pardon the whole city."

verses.kjv: And though they say, The LORD liveth; surely they swear falsely.
verses.web: Though they say, ‘As LORD lives,’ surely they swear falsely.”
verses.ct: Even when they say, 'As surely as the LORD lives,' they are lying through their teeth.

verses.kjv: O LORD, are not thine eyes upon the truth? thou hast stricken them, but they have not grieved; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
verses.web: O LORD, don’t your eyes look on truth? You have stricken them, but they were not grieved. You have consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction. They have made their faces harder than a rock. They have refused to return.
verses.ct: LORD, don't you look for honesty? You struck them down, but they felt no pain. You nearly destroyed them, but they refused to learn their lesson. They set their faces harder than stone and refused to turn back to you.

verses.kjv: Therefore I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish: for they know not the way of the LORD, nor the judgment of their God.
verses.web: Then I said, “Surely these are poor. They are foolish; for they don’t know the LORD’s way, nor the law of their God.
verses.ct: So I thought, "These must just be the poor and uneducated. They don't know the LORD's ways or what their God requires of them."

verses.kjv: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the LORD, and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
verses.web: I will go to the great men and will speak to them, for they know the way of LORD, and the law of their God.” But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
verses.ct: "I'll go talk to the leaders instead — surely they know the LORD's ways and the laws of their God." But they had all thrown off God's authority and broken free from every restraint.

verses.kjv: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, and a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their cities: every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many, and their backslidings are increased.
verses.web: Therefore a lion out of the forest will kill them. A wolf of the evenings will destroy them. A leopard will watch against their cities. Everyone who goes out there will be torn in pieces, because their transgressions are many and their backsliding has increased.
verses.ct: Because of this, a lion from the forest will strike them down, a wolf from the wilderness will tear them apart, and a leopard will stalk their cities. Anyone who steps outside will be ripped to pieces — because their sins are piled high and their unfaithfulness keeps growing.

verses.kjv: How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
verses.web: “How can I pardon you? Your children have forsaken me, and sworn by what are no gods. When I had fed them to the full, they committed adultery, and assembled themselves in troops at the prostitutes’ houses.
verses.ct: "How can I possibly forgive you for this? Your children have abandoned me and sworn oaths by things that aren't even gods. I gave them everything they needed, and they repaid me with adultery, crowding into the houses of prostitutes.

verses.kjv: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
verses.web: They were as fed horses roaming at large. Everyone neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
verses.ct: They are like well-fed stallions on the loose — each one lusting after his neighbor's wife.

verses.kjv: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the LORD: and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.web: Shouldn’t I punish them for these things?” says LORD. “Shouldn’t my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.ct: Shouldn't I punish them for this?" says the LORD. "Shouldn't I take my revenge on a nation like this?

verses.kjv: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her battlements; for they are not the LORD’s.
verses.web: “Go up on her walls, and destroy; but don’t make a full end. Take away her branches, for they are not LORD’s.
verses.ct: "Go through her vineyards and cut them down — but don't destroy them completely. Strip away her branches, because they don't belong to the LORD.

verses.kjv: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: The people of Israel and the people of Judah have been utterly unfaithful to me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: They have belied the LORD, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:
verses.web: They have denied LORD, and said, “It is not he. Evil will won’t come on us. We won’t see sword or famine.
verses.ct: They have lied about the LORD, saying, "He won't do anything. No disaster will come to us. We'll never see war or famine."

verses.kjv: And the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
verses.web: The prophets will become wind, and the word is not in them. Thus it will be done to them.”
verses.ct: "The prophets are nothing but hot air — God's word isn't really in them. Let what they predict happen to them instead!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore thus saith the LORD God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
verses.web: Therefore LORD, the God of Armies says, “Because you speak this word, behold, I will make my words in your mouth fire, and this people wood, and it will devour them.
verses.ct: So the LORD, the God of Armies, says this: "Because you people talk this way, I will turn my words in Jeremiah's mouth into fire, and you will be the wood it burns through."

verses.kjv: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith the LORD: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
verses.web: Behold, I will bring a nation on you from far away, house of Israel,” says LORD. “It is a mighty nation. It is an ancient nation, a nation whose language you don’t know and don’t understand what they say.
verses.ct: "Watch — I am bringing a nation against you from far away, people of Israel," says the LORD. "It is a powerful nation, an ancient nation, a nation whose language you don't know and whose words you can't understand.

verses.kjv: Their quiver is as an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.
verses.web: Their quiver is an open tomb. They are all mighty men.
verses.ct: Their quivers are like open graves — every arrow means death. They are all seasoned warriors.

verses.kjv: And they shall eat up thine harvest, and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat: they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds: they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees: they shall impoverish thy fenced cities, wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.
verses.web: They will eat up your harvest and your bread, which your sons and your daughters should eat. They will eat up your flocks and your herds. They will eat up your vines and your fig trees. They will beat down your fortified cities in which you trust with the sword.
verses.ct: They will devour your harvests and your food that your sons and daughters should have eaten. They will consume your flocks and herds. They will strip your vineyards and fig trees bare. They will smash your fortified cities — the ones you trusted to keep you safe — with the sword.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless in those days, saith the LORD, I will not make a full end with you.
verses.web: “But even in those days,” says LORD, “I will not make a full end of you.
verses.ct: "But even in those days," says the LORD, "I will not completely destroy you.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore doeth the LORD our God all these things unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
verses.web: It will happen when you say, ‘Why has LORD our God done all these things to us?’ Then you shall say to them, ‘Just as you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’
verses.ct: When the people ask, 'Why has the LORD our God done all this to us?' you will answer them: 'Just as you abandoned me and served foreign gods in your own land, so you will serve foreigners in a land that isn't yours.'"

verses.kjv: Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
verses.web: “Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
verses.ct: "Announce this to the descendants of Jacob and proclaim it throughout Judah:

verses.kjv: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear not:
verses.web: ‘Hear this now, foolish people without understanding, who have eyes, and don’t see, who have ears, and don’t hear:
verses.ct: 'Listen to this, you foolish people who have no understanding — you have eyes but don't see, you have ears but don't hear.

verses.kjv: Fear ye not me? saith the LORD: will ye not tremble at my presence, which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it?
verses.web: Don’t you fear me?’ says LORD ‘Won’t you tremble at my presence, who have placed the sand for the bound of the sea, by a perpetual decree, that it can’t pass it? Though its waves toss themselves, yet they can’t prevail. Though they roar, they still can’t pass over it.’
verses.ct: Don't you fear me?' says the LORD. 'Won't you tremble in my presence? I'm the one who set the sand as a boundary for the sea, an eternal limit it can never cross. The waves may crash and roar, but they cannot break through it.'

verses.kjv: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
verses.web: “But this people has a revolting and a rebellious heart. They have revolted and gone.
verses.ct: "But these people have stubborn, rebellious hearts. They have turned away and are gone.

verses.kjv: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear the LORD our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in his season: he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
verses.web: They don’t say in their heart, ‘Let’s now fear LORD our God, who gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season, who preserves to us the appointed weeks of the harvest.’
verses.ct: They never stop to think, 'We should fear the LORD our God — the one who sends the autumn and spring rains right on schedule and guarantees us the weeks of harvest.'

verses.kjv: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good things from you.
verses.web: “Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld good from you.
verses.ct: "Your sins have disrupted all of this. Your wrongdoing has kept these good things from reaching you.

verses.kjv: For among my people are found wicked men: they lay wait, as he that setteth snares; they set a trap, they catch men.
verses.web: For wicked men are found among my people. They watch, as fowlers lie in wait. They set a trap. They catch men.
verses.ct: Wicked people lurk among my people. They crouch in hiding like bird trappers, setting snares to catch other human beings.

verses.kjv: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.
verses.web: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit. Therefore they have become great, and grew rich.
verses.ct: Like a cage stuffed full of birds, their houses are stuffed full of stolen wealth. That's how they've become powerful and rich.

verses.kjv: They are waxen fat, they shine: yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked: they judge not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, yet they prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
verses.web: They have grown fat. They shine; yes, they excel in deeds of wickedness. They don’t plead the cause, the cause of the fatherless, that they may prosper; and they don’t defend the rights of the needy.
verses.ct: They've grown sleek and fat. Their evil knows no limits. They refuse to defend orphans in court or fight for the rights of the poor.

verses.kjv: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the LORD: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.web: “Shouldn’t I punish for these things?” says LORD. “Shouldn’t my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.ct: "Shouldn't I punish them for this?" says the LORD. "Shouldn't I take my revenge on a nation like this?"

verses.kjv: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;
verses.web: “An astonishing and horrible thing has happened in the land.
verses.ct: "Something shocking and horrifying has happened in this land:

verses.kjv: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
verses.web: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests rule by their own authority; and my people love to have it so. What will you do in the end of it?
verses.ct: The prophets speak lies, the priests rule by their own authority, and my people love it that way. But what will you do when it all comes crashing down?"
